Posts.Title: Pork Chop Bone!!!

Posts.Content:
I am no doc and that is who I would check with, but I was on effexor and they switched me to celexa. I also take ambien when having problems sleeping. I have not noticed any problems mixing the two. I will tell you that I read somewhere that you shouldn't take Tylenol PM if you are just wanting to sleep. It said you shouldn't take more meds than you need as in Tylenol PM...it also has med for pain and fever, etc. Tylenol has a new product out that I can vouch for called Simply Sleep. It is just to aid in sleeping and no other meds. Good luck!
L&H

Posts.Title: Cathi news......

Posts.Content: Hello everyone.  Just got back from 5 days at the lake and boy was it ever needed.  We had a great time.  I have to share with you that we just bought a new truck and when we were getting out at the camp site a pink feather drifted out of the drivers side floorboard.  Now I repeat this is a brand new truck and I have no idea how that pink feather got there, but I know what it meant and did for me.  I'm Back!  Last week I had my annual Onc appt and everything looked fine.  whew...was sweating that one.  But, the best news came Sunday at the lake.  My son and his wife and my precious granddaughter came down to visit at the lake and my DGD announced that she is going to be a big sister!!!  Yes!  I going to have another grandbaby!!  I am so excited!  Yes, finally life is good again.  Sorry I have been absent, but I will try to do better now.

I would say NO, they may get a good idea but the only fool proof way to tell if it is cancer is to do a biopsy. I was 43 when dx and you will find lots of ladies here much younger. I had no history of bc in my family and have never smoked. Sometimes...most of the time we can find no reason for this happening to us. I will keep you in my prayers for a B9 result. Posts.Content: I am having such a difficult time with the news of Becky's passing.  I can't even imagine what Angela is dealing with.  They were so very close.  I was sitting here at work thinking back to the Louisville Weekend.  I think Louisville was selected because Becky wasn't strong enough to travel far at that time.  She was so excited about everyone coming to Louisville and we all had such a grand time meeting and planning and laughing.  For those of you who made it, hang on to those special t-shirts as they were lovingly made by Becky and Angela.  So much fun and anticipation went into that weekend and it was more than we could have expected.  So dear Sisters...for now I am reliving those in person hugs and imagining all of us together that weekend.  I'm glad Becky is at peace now and without pain and worry, but oh how I will miss her.

Posts.Title: pain and such

Posts.Content: It was an unbelievable beautiful day in Louisville KY today.  Beautiful blue sky, warm temp and it was Becky's day to celebrate her life.  I thought Angela would tell you but when I walked into visitation last night our beautiful Becky looked so peaceful and in her hand was a New Testament with a pink feather peeking out.  I completely broke down, but what a wonderful and yet sutle way Mike allowed Angela to help Becky take us all with her.  Angela and I both had pink feathers with us at the cementary, so each of you were well represented, we placed some on the flowers on the coffin and and we let the rest float away freely.  It was an especially difficult day and I can't write as well as most of you, but I felt you all with us and it was a beautiful day in spite of the saddness.  Becky's DH is one of the most wonderful people you can imagine and he has a wonderful family and support group around him.  Please keep them and especially Angela in your prayers as Angela has not only lost a dear friend but they had become more like sisters and she is really feeling the lost.  I think I am all out of tears, it has been a really rough day.  But our Dear Sweet Becky is flying high with the Angels and is at peace now, so I am clinging to that image.  Love you all

Posts.Title: New Here

Posts.Content:
Tammy, you have every right to be scared! I had a mast. and all my nodes were clear so I thought I would dodge that bullet, not to be. When they told me I should have chemo I lost it. But, I decided I would do everything possible to fight this and I did. I lived alone and after my first chemo I came home and sat there waiting for something to happen....I felt like a time bomb waiting to explode. I did have some quezzyness but nothing meds couldn't handle. The hair loss for me was tramatic but after it happened it really was nice getting ready for work in the mornings, didn't take much time at all. I too have a new hair style that otherwise I probably would have never tried. You will make it and we will be here to hold your hand or support you when ever you need it. Just watch for the pink feathers!
L&H

Posts.Title: Clutter: Who do you like for the Super Bowl?

Posts.Content:
I was dx at 43, I had a mast and no node involvement. I did have chemo. My doc said at my age and even though they got the tumor out and thought they got it all he strongly advised chemo. I didn't like it but I lived through it, and I kept telling myself it was the most aggressive thing I could do to beat this. It did put me into menapause, but I have found that missing those monthly visits isn't all bad. Hot flashes have subsided and I am fine. Four years now and I have many battle scars but they tend to fade a bit over the years and are just a gentle reminder of all I've been through. Good luck to you! We are all here for you.
L&H

My son shaved mine and took out all his frustrations of me grounding him while growing up while doing it. We laughed and laughed. One thing I did have to have and you might want to check into it is a sleep cap. My little bald head would get so cold at night, so I found a wonderful sleep cap and it kept me nice and warm. ahhh the little things! Your attitude is great, don't lose that it will help you more than you know. My hair grew back curly unlike the poker straight hair before, but after a year I was back to straight, but it was fun while it lasted. You will be amazed at how fast you can get ready in the mornings! LOL Good Luck to you and keep us posted.

Posts.Title: What do skin mets look like

Posts.Content: I had to put my Mother in the hospital last night.  She had a stress test done and they wanted her admitted to the hospital immediately.  This morning they did a heart cath and discovered she has had a heart attack and has one artery 99.% blocked and another one somewhat blocked.  She is scheduled for angioplasty Friday morning.  The big problem is they are not sure when she had the heart attack and not sure if the damage can be corrected.  She is in good spirits and doing well all things considered.  If you could please say prayer for us Friday morning it would be most appreciated.
Posts.Title: Prayers Please

Posts.Content:

I had four with my surgery, it was around Christmas when I got them out and kept two of them and made Christmas ornaments out of them. Most expensive ornaments I have! LOL I don't mean to scare you but chemo was the hardest part for me. But you will get through it and we will all be here to help you. Keep us posted on what you find out and take it easy.

Posts.Title: Ok, time to dust off your psych degrees...

Posts.Content: First off thank you all again so much for the prayers and well wishes.  Mom's surgery went really good.  There is some major damage but he got the stint in and the artery open and she is doing really well.  This morning we were up walking the halls and she is eating good and looks good.  She is in good spirits and has no more pain!  One of her nurses calls her the social butterfly.  She turned 80 this past December and no one can believe it.  Of course she is eating up all the attention too!  She will go home Monday.  So even though there was a heart attack and damage we are all greatful for the outcome.  Hope everyone has a wonderful New Year and I love you all!
